articles.title: Show HN: FIDO2 PRF with TPM and Fingerprint Auth for Confer on Linux
articles.description:
I wanted to try Confer â€” Moxie Marlinspikeâ€™s private AI chat â€” but I donâ€™t have a Mac lying around. Since it requires isUserVerifyingPlatformAuthenticatorAvailable(), and most Linux setups donâ€™t qualify, I put together a minimal platform authenticator that works with what I have: a TPM and a fingerprint reader.

Itâ€™s a small bridge: Chrome extension + Go backend, using the TPM for key storage and fprintd for user verification.

Write-up: https://vitorpy.com/blog/2025-12-25-confer-to-linux-tpm-fido... Code: https://github.com/vitorpy/tpm-fido2-prf

Nothing fancy. No guarantees â€” it was a quick hack. But if it helps someone else get Confer working on Linux :)
